intro: Bunium nudum, commonly known as the naked siliqua, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white flowers and fern-like leaves. The plant produces elongated, dry fruits called siliques, which are typically hairless or nearly so, giving it its common name. Bunium nudum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. It has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
